sen.j: 朽木 晴綱（くつき はるつな、永正15年（1518年） - 天文 (元号)19年（1550年））は朽木元綱の父。
sen.e: Harutsuna KUTUKI (1518-1550) was Mototsuna KUTSUKI's father.
Harutsuna KUTUKI (1518 - 1550) was Mototsuna KUTSUKI's father.
Harutsuna KUTUKI (1518 - 1550) was Mototsuna KUTSUKI's father.

sen.j: 朽木稙綱 (戦国武将)の子。
sen.e: He was a child of Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (Sengoku busho; Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period).
He was a child of Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (Sengoku busho; Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period).
He was a child of Tanetsuna KUTSUKI (Sengoku busho; Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period).
His wife was a daughter of Masatsuna ASUKAI.
His wife was a daughter of Masatsuna ASUKAI.
His wife was a daughter of Masatsuna ASUKAI.
He was the lord of Kutsuki-dani-jo Castle in Omi Province.
He was the lord of Kutsuki-dani-jo Castle in Omi Province.
He was the lord of Kutsuki-dani-jo Castle in Omi Province.

sen.j: 朽木氏は高島氏の支族。
sen.e: The Kutsuki clan was a branch family of the Takashima clan.
The Kutsuki clan was a branch family of the Takashima clan.
The Kutsuki clan was a branch family of the Takashima clan.

sen.j: 足利義晴より偏諱の授与を受けて晴綱と名乗る。
sen.e: He called himself 'Harutsuna' after he was granted to use a portion of the real name of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA.
He called himself 'Harutsuna' after he was granted to use a portion of the real name of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA.
He called himself 'Harutsuna' after he was granted to use a portion of the real name of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA.
His common name was 'Yagoro.'
His common name was 'Yagoro.'
His common name was 'Yagoro.'
Kunai shoyu/Kunai no sho (Junior Assistant Minister of the Sovereign's Household)
Kunai shoyu/Kunai no sho (Junior Assistant Minister of the Sovereign's Household)
Kunai shoyu/Kunai no sho (Junior Assistant Minister of the Sovereign's Household)

sen.j: 兄弟に朽木藤綱、朽木成綱、朽木直綱、朽木輝孝がいる。
sen.e: His brothers were Fujitsuna KUTSUKI, Shigetsuna KUTSUKI, Naotsuna KUTSUKI and Terutaka KUTSUKI.
His brothers were Fujitsuna KUTSUKI, Shigetsuna KUTSUKI, Naotsuna KUTSUKI and Terutaka KUTSUKI.
His brothers were Fujitsuna KUTSUKI, Shigetsuna KUTSUKI, Naotsuna KUTSUKI and Terutaka KUTSUKI.

sen.j: 室町幕府の奉公衆を務める。
sen.e: He served as hokoshu (a military post in Muromachi Shogunate) of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
He served as hokoshu (a military post in Muromachi Shogunate) of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
He served as hokoshu (a military post in Muromachi Shogunate) of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 足利義澄（永正4年（1507年））、足利義晴（享禄元年（1528年）、晴綱の死後の天文20年（1551年）の2回）といった細川氏や三好氏に京都から追われた足利将軍を朽木谷で保護した。
sen.e: In Kutsuki-dani, he and his family harbored several Ashikaga shoguns who were driven out of Kyoto by the Hosokawa clan or the Miyoshi clan like Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA in 1507, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA in 1528, and two more cases in 1551 after Harutsuna died.

In Kutsuki-dani, he and his family harbored several Ashikaga shoguns who were driven out of Kyoto by the Hosokawa clan or the Miyoshi clan like Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA in 1507, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA in 1528, and two more cases in 1551 after Harutsuna died.

In Kutsuki-dani, he and his family harbored several Ashikaga shoguns who were driven out of Kyoto by the Hosokawa clan or the Miyoshi clan like Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA in 1507, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA in 1528, and two more cases in 1551 after Harutsuna died.

sen.j: また、足利義晴方として、派兵をして諸将と戦った。
sen.e: Also, on the side of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA he fought with warlords dispatching troops.
Also, on the side of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA he fought with warlords dispatching troops.
Also, on the side of Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA he fought with warlords dispatching troops.

sen.j: しかし、1550年、朽木氏の本家である高島氏の高島越中守と高島郡河上荘俵山で戦い、戦死した。
sen.e: However, in 1550 when he fought in Tawarayama of Kawakami-sho, Takashima county with Takashima Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) from the Takashima clan, who was the head family of the Kutsuki clan, he died in the war.

However, in 1550 when he fought in Tawarayama of Kawakami-sho, Takashima county with Takashima Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) from the Takashima clan, who was the head family of the Kutsuki clan, he died in the war.

However, in 1550 when he fought in Tawarayama of Kawakami-sho, Takashima county with Takashima Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province) from the Takashima clan, who was the head family of the Kutsuki clan, he died in the war.
